properties.headline: NRL Grand Final - Sunday 25 October - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Parramatta Rd approaching ANZ Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Route 525 and 526 buses will be diverting around closures in Sydney Olympic Park. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
2020 NRL Grand Final at ANZ Stadium, Olympic Park, kick off from 7:30pm, full-time 9:30pm approx. Preliminary game from 4:05pm. 

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on key roads approaching ANZ Stadium including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Roads in the precinct will be closed from as early as 2am including sections of Olympic Blvd, Showground Rd, Murray Rose Ave and Dawn Fraser Ave. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time if driving in the area.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time (available until 23:59 Sat 24 Oct)

arrangementElements.html:
From 7pm Saturday 24 October

  • Dawn Fraser Avenue between Olympic Boulevard and Showground Road

From 2am Sunday 25 October until 2am Monday 26 October

  • Dawn Fraser Avenue from Showground Road to Edwin Flack Avenue
  • Olympic Boulevard from Herb Elliot Avenue to Kevin Coombs Avenue
  • Showground Road from Grand Parade to Dawn Fraser Avenue
  • Murray Rose Avenue from Showground Road to Gate 15
  • Grand Parade from Australia Avenue to Olympic Boulevard

From 9am Sunday 25 October until 2am Monday 26 October

  • Dawn Fraser Avenue from Park Street to Showground Road
  • Showground Road from Herb Elliot Avenue to Dawn Fraser Avenue (Novotel Loading Dock)
  • Olympic Boulevard from Herb Elliot Avenue to Sarah Durack Avenue
  • Kevin Coombs Avenue from Australia Avenue to Pondage Link
  • Shane Gould Avenue from P2A to Olympic Boulelvard
  • Herb Elliot Avenue from Olympic Boulevard to Showground Road
  • Murray Rose Avenue from Showground Road to Park Street
  • Shirley Strickland Avenue from Rod Laver Drive to Olympic Boulevard
  • Shirley Strickland Avenue from Olympic Boulevard to the M4 Exit (P4 car park)
  • Rod Laver Drive from Shirley Strickland Avenu to the Tennis Centre

From 8pm Sunday 25 October until 11:30pm Sunday 25 October (*buses excepted)

  • Dawn Fraser Avenue from Park Street to Australia Avenue*
  • Murray Rose Avenue from Park Street to Australia Avenue*
  • Herb Elliot Avenue from Park Street to Showground Road
  • Edwin Flack Avenue from Birnie Avenue to Old Hill Link (northbound)
  • Edwin Flack Avenue from Pondage Link to Old Hill Link (westbound)
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

roads.mainStreet: M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Parramatta Rd

properties.headline: Bathurst 1000 - Thursday 15 to Sunday 18 October - BATHURST Great Western Hwy, Mitchell Hwy, Mid-Western Hwy approaching Mount Panorama
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 4,000 people each day are expected to attend the annual Bathurst 1000 motor racing event from Thursday to Sunday at Mount Panorama. Gates open from 8.30am Thursday and 8am Friday to Sunday. Racing finishes between 5pm and 6pm each day.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on key roads between Sydney and Bathurst including the M4 Mwy, Great Western Highway and Bells Line of Rd, and along the Mitchell Hwy from Orange, the Mid-Western Hwy from Cowra and the Castlereagh Hwy from Mudgee.

Local roads in Bathurst are also expected to be busy. Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time in the area during the event.

arrangementElements.html:
BATHURST 

6AM MONDAY 12 OCTOBER UNTIL 2PM MONDAY 19 OCTOBER

  • Access to Mount Panorama Motor-racing Circuit will be limited to residents and accredited vehicles 
  • Ray Bant Drive will be under managed access
  • Access to the National Motor-Racing Museum (Ray Bant Drive) will be facilitated between Monday 12 October through to Wednesday 14 October (event week), the venue will be closed to the public on event days
  • Access to Mount Panorama Motor-Racing circuit via Hinton Road will closed

THURSDAY 15 OCTOBER UNTIL SUNDAY 18 OCTOBER

  • Access to Ray Bant Drive will be limited to Residents, Rydges guests/workers and accredited workers/vehicles
arrangementElements.title: Changed access arrangements

roads.mainStreet: Great Western Hwy, Mitchell Hwy, Mid-Western Hwy

properties.headline: NSW Touch Championships - Saturday 17 and Sunday 18 October - TUGGERAH Bryant Dr, Lake Rd approaching Central Coast Regional Sporting & Recreation Complex
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 500 people per day are expected to attend the 2020 NSW Touch Football Country Championships at the Central Coast Regional Sporting & Recreation Complex in Tuggerah from 8am to 6pm Saturday and Sunday. 

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual along Bryant Dr and Lake Rd as attendees travel to and from the venue throughout the weekend.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.
properties.displayName: NSW Touch Championships - Saturday 17 and Sunday 18 October

roads.crossStreet: Central Coast Regional Sporting & Recreation Complex
